attributes.additional_details: The bishops’ statement is aimed at world leaders who are preparing for a UN climate summit in Poland this December.  We call for ambitious and immediate action to be taken in order to tackle and overcome the devastating effects of the climate crisis. These actions need to be taken by the international community at all levels: by persons, communities, cities, regions, nations.
attributes.background:
The heads of six continental bishops’ conferences have signed a rare joint statement urging political leaders to solve climate change. 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RNyH9cDBuEvt54Yi1PnUADDE8InOdUSm/view

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about climate change, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

If you want the Government to pledge 5% of the UK's annual GDP to halt climate change, you may wish to sign this petition instead: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/226750
